meanings.definition: The restoration of blood flow to an organ or tissue after a period of ischemia.
meanings.sent1: After the heart attack, the doctors quickly performed reperfusion to save the damaged tissue.
meanings.sent2: Reperfusion is crucial in preventing further damage to the brain during a stroke.
meanings.sent3: The race car driver joked that his pit crew's reperfusion of fuel was faster than his own heart rate.
meanings.sent4: The reperfusion of nutrients to the soil after a drought brought life back to the withered plants.
meanings.sent5: The reperfusion of energy into the tired muscles rejuvenated the athlete for the final sprint.

meanings.definition: The process of reintroducing oxygenated blood to an area of the body that has been deprived of oxygen.
meanings.sent1: The paramedics administered reperfusion to the patient who had stopped breathing.
meanings.sent2: In emergency situations, immediate reperfusion can be life-saving.
meanings.sent3: The scuba diver humorously compared the oxygen tank to a reperfusion machine for fish out of water.
meanings.sent4: The artist saw inspiration as a reperfusion of creativity flowing back into her work.
meanings.sent5: The reperfusion of color to the black-and-white painting brought it to life with vibrancy.
